Hydras:

"Good Speech, little one" said the Decepticon's leader"Good one...=
 i wondered why not dedicate your self to be a politican... but You are ver=
y WRONG!!!! I'm Megatron and Galvatron Fused... I'm one and both... Rodimus=
 has chosen his path and is one of OURS, with him in our said what can STOP=
 us us to rule and Conquest as is our fate? but such loyalty have to be rew=
ard it.... Rodimus, defeat this little annoyance and capture him... after y=
ou have enjoyed yourself hurtting him"


From: Sandy 
Sent: Thursday, Febru=
ary 18, 2010 9:46 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Ro=
dimus/BlackFortress


  
With a lightning reflex, Tucson catches Rodimus's =
punch, with his right hand, and balls a powerful fist around it. He concent=
rates the energy from his all wheel drive systems into that one hand and us=
es it as a vise around Rodimus's fist. 

" Trust me, I don't want to do thi=
s Rodimus. I'm not getting any enjoyment out of what I'm doing. But if this=
 is the only way to get through to you, then so be it."

With his free hand=
, Tucson now concentrates the all wheel drive power into his left arm, and =
manages to twist Rodimus's arms behind him, holding him in a powerful grapp=
le. His hands clamp down painfully hard onto Rodimus's arms, and his grip r=
emains as solid as a powerful vise. 

" You fail to see that what Hydras, S=
courge and Cyclonus are doing, is merely using you as a pawn. They've tampe=
red with you and have no intentions of giving you power. All they want is t=
he power you possess, and it appears they are succeeding in doing so. I kno=
w you have it within you to conquor this hold they have over you. You just =
have to want it bad enough to do it. The Rodimus I know would NEVER fall to=
 such low standards. THE RODIMUS I KNOW WOULD BE STRONG AND RESIST THE TEMP=
TATIONS THAT BEFALL HIM! But I see you are not that Rodimus anymore. You ha=
ve become no better than MEGATRON! IS THAT WHAT YOU WANT?! TO HAVE A HISTOR=
Y THE SAME AS THE INFAMOUS DECEPTICON LEADER WHO WROTE HIS OWN DEMISE?! TO =
HAVE EVERYONE DESPISE YOU AND WANT NOTHING MORE THAN TO DESTROY YOU?! IS TH=
AT HOW YOU WISH TO BE REVERED?! I WILL NOT LET THAT HAPPEN! DO YOU HEAR ME,=
 I WILL NOT LET THAT HAPPEN!"

He finally rams Rodimus up against a wall wi=
th a powerful slam, and holds him there.

"BY THE NAME OF PRIMUS I WILL NOT=
 LOSE MY LEADER TO CORRUPTED FORCES!"

Determination mixed with rage. It wa=
s what Tucson was now feeling. He had been subdued enough, and now he was i=
tching to show his true colors. Even though he had used a bit of brute stre=
ngth against Rodimus, he takes great care not to damage him gravely.

--- I=
n nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> >" =
I'm sure you wouldn't have wanted to do this either Optimus, and 
> >I can =
see why that sometimes the hardest lessons are learned when you face an 
> =
>enemy upon who has been your comrade for many years. But if this were you,=
 I 
> >trust you would do the same."
> 
> For a moment, as Rodimus stood th=
ere before this somewhat smaller Autobot there was a brief moment of clarit=
y, a small instant of indecision. This Autobot showed a bravery and strengt=
h that seemed oddly familiar to him. 
> 
> >" All right, have it your way R=
odimus. This is going to hurt me 
> >more than it will hurt you." 
> 
> How=
ever the moment passed as the dark Predacon shell programming that twisted =
his own kicked in. He smiled, as he cracked his knuckles, "You're right, th=
is is *will* hurt you more than it will hurt me." Rodimus replied in mockin=
g tones. 
> 
> With a quick motion he stepped foward to snap a quick punch =
towards Tuscon's head, ready to end this battle with this little upstart Au=
tobot - there was something about him that annoyed him!
> 
> In the meantim=
e Cyclonus and Scourge had stepped back; watching the opening of the battle=
 with looks of eagerness as they studied the moves of both combants.
> 
> (=
TAG)
> 
> Preston
> (Cyclonus/Scourge/Rodimus)
>
